head.title: Triarc Spins Off Snapple Beverage Unit

hedline.hl1: Triarc Spins Off Snapple Beverage Unit

abstract.p: Triarc spins off Snapple Beverage Group, based in White Plains, NY; Michael Weinstein is named chief executive of new public company, Snapple Beverage Group (S)

block.p: Triarc, with headquarters in Manhattan, has spun off its White Plains-based beverage group into a new public company to be called Snapple Beverage Group.

The new company, which will have headquarters in White Plains, will be led by the chief executive of Triarc Beverage Group, Michael Weinstein, who will have the title of chief executive officer. It will own Triarc's premium beverage business (Snapple, Mistic and Stewart's) and its soft drink concentrates business (Royal Crown, Diet Rite, RC Edge and Nehi).

Snapple expects to complete the initial public offering in the third quarter of this year, subject to Security and Exchange Commission review, market conditions and other factors. Triarc is also a restaurant franchiser (Arby's, T. J. Cinnamons and Pasta Connection).
